H0.text: Finding shelter is the life need that camouflage most helps an animal with.

H1.text: Hiding from predators is the life need that camouflage most helps an animal satisfy.

H2.text: Gathering enough food is the life need that camouflage most helps an animal with.

H3.text: Raising young is the life need that camouflage most helps an animal with.

A4.text: Members of the cat family such as the snow leopard (treeless highlands), tiger (grassy plains, reed swamps), ocelot (forest), fishing cat (waterside thickets), and lion (open plains) are camouflaged with coloration and disruptive patterns suiting their habitats.

A5.text: Flower mantises are ambush predators; camouflaged as flowers, such as orchids, they attract prey and seize it when it is close enough.

A8.text: This gave dark-coloured moths a better chance of surviving to produce dark-coloured offspring
